text: Transient transfections using reporter constructs with multiples of transcription factor binding sites from the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter [ distal nuclear factor ( NF ) - AT , proximal NF-AT , AP-1 / Octamer ( UPS ) or NF-chi B ( TCEd ) sites ] were performed .
In EBV-transformed B clones , the chi B site exerted the strongest inducible activity ; the NF-AT binding sites showed either no or only weak activity compared to Jurkat T cells .
An <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter bearing a defective NF-chi B site was completely inactive in EBV-transformed B cells , while it still had activity in Jurkat T cells .
